About ServiceFi

Building the future where time, access, and labor are liquid financial assets.

Our Vision

ServiceFi lays the foundation for a future where:

  • Time, access, and labor are liquid financial assets
  • Small businesses fund themselves without banks
  • DeFi capital directly powers everyday services
  • Real economic activity becomes composable on-chain

Built on Mantle

ServiceFi is built on Mantle Network because:

  • Low transaction costs enable micro-value services to be economically viable
  • High throughput supports high-frequency redemption and minting
  • RealFi focus aligns with service-based economies and real-world utility
  • Real-world adoption beyond speculation
One-Line Thesis

ServiceFi turns future services into instant liquidity—unlocking real yield from real work.

Frequently Asked Questions

What happens if a service is not redeemed?

Tokens have built-in expiration dates. Unredeemed tokens automatically expire and self-liquidate, returning the discount value to the liquidity pool. This natural mechanism eliminates complex enforcement.

How is service redemption verified?

Businesses verify redemption through their point-of-sale systems integrated with our smart contracts. The token is burned on-chain when the service is delivered, creating an immutable record.

What protects liquidity providers from business default?

Risk is diversified across multiple businesses and service types. Each token is time-bounded, limiting exposure. Additionally, businesses undergo verification and maintain reputation scores based on redemption rates.

Can I resell service tokens?

Yes, tokens are fully transferable and can be traded on secondary markets. This creates additional liquidity for both customers and investors.

How do you prevent fake services or fraud?

Businesses must complete a verification process including proof of business registration, location verification, and track record review. Ongoing monitoring tracks redemption rates and customer reviews.

What types of services work best?

Services with predictable demand, established customer bases, and clear redemption mechanics work best. Personal services, recurring memberships, and professional consultations are ideal categories.
